y1n4yQufO3h-e5aQM5kgtQ.text: Dear Da Mario,I wanted to let you know that you are really good at getting me interested in coming into your establishment. You provided a bright neon sign promoting DISCO Pizza; and to add to that, it's Princess Diana's "favourite" place for a pie. Once I looked at the menu, I further realized you're the guy that created to pizza for Pizza Express, which fed me and saved me on numerous occasions when I first came to London.You proved your masculinity with the giant establishment, featuring a good sized room on the ground floor and a sprawling downstairs area that was hustling and bustling. However, this is where your epic fail began. Despite you promptly seating our group of six people, you put us in an unoccupied area that was nice for us as we could actually hear each other talking, but no one came to take our orders, ever.For the love of Princess Di, one of the people in our group had her arms waving in the air trying to get the employees walking in and out of our rooms attention. This kept on for twenty minutes. 20 minutes, you ignored us. We were all ready to give you our orders of Diana's Disco Pizza Express Pizza, but no, you snubbed us. So, when our collective patience left, so did we. Right out the door, back past several of your employees that ignored us and we left. I will never come back to you Da Mario, in fact, every time I go to Pizza Express now, I will curse your name and repeat "never again." In all honesty, not even the people at the place that cannot ever be mentioned had better service and a better attitude.Sincerely,Yelper #3 of 5 that you pissed off all at once

lYbxpg2BVO_sA6cGBfIVhQ.text: So, Da Mario promptly seated a party of six downstairs, alone.And promptly forgot them.I was in that party, sat with my arms in the air waving them after fifteen minutes, and the server who walked into the room to get to the bar (no fewer than five times) averted her eyes every. single. time, simply pretending that we did not exist.We left after nearly 20 minutes of sitting at a cramped table with menus and nothing else.And no one said anything to us as we walked out.Princess Diana's favourite pizzeria?  The People's Princess must have really enjoyed shit service.  Maybe it's where she went to connect with the people. And feel like one of them - a pleb.

LvokNonEIu0r5sHuKKGx3g.text: Well... this place sucks. No I didn't eat here, but I wanted to. With such a promising facade, DISCO PIZZERIA, in neon, we had high hopes. Outside on the steps, it boasts Princess Diana's pizzeria. Err yeah. Inside, the bustling restaurant was full of people enjoying pizza and wine, as you do. We were offered the choice of a table in the path of serious wind chill from the door or downstairs. Downstairs, they seemed to have a few rooms and we were gestured towards an empty one that felt like a train station waiting room. And we waited... and waited. Eventually we got menus and all picked delicious sounding dishes. Broccoli on pizza? I'm in! What was most annoying was that there was a waitress coming in and out of the room with us, totally blanking our attempts to call her over. Wo - ow. Worst service ever. So we left.

R7I9Pr8IqOnR9xKgRWA7Wg.text: we dined on several occasions in there. Very nice honest food. Well priced. Therefore always packed with people.

WxqPZ0uMyOfuAjS-GfeMQA.text: Not a good move to ignore a bunch of people who spend their free time writing about places they eat on the internet. We were seated in the dungeon, and at first I was excited to have a room to ourselves. But then it stayed just ourselves. Sometimes a server would poke her head in, and we would frantically wave, but no dice. Not even drinks. I offered to get up and go find the server. We decided instead to all get up and go find somewhere else to eat.It's noted out front that this was Princess Di's favorite pizza place, but I bet that Di used to actually get her order taken. I, on the other hand, had to leave without getting to try either their disco or their pizza.

P40RmEt4MKum5mebp8e8oQ.text: What a great restaurant!  Right near our hotel and our sons flat, location is perfect, but than again so is the food!  Salads and pizza are perfect!  Wait...papardelle is so good too!  We just got back from our trip to London and ate there twice.  Each time the service was great, but the food is even better!

XjrN4Et-HXTAHQRj1oR3bQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant in London!  The food is amazing (especially the veal stuffed torteloni.)  Every time I visit I make sure to go here.  The prices are also reasonable

xHjFNQsYp1ekilbJiT5KIg.text: Food was very good, service was excellent, reasonably priced.  Easy to get a table on a Saturday evening. Restaurant was busy but not crowded.

2B0te3iY07aOlSZZq3SMaA.text: Very good Restaurant!!!! I have to say! I was there three times and the food is very good. They serve a range of Seafood dishes and very good Pizza. Also vergetarians will be convinced. The food is not overseasoned and the ingredients are fresh tasty and well prepared. The Prize is low compared to the quality. So it is more than worth the Money.

aVgXu1-XFJn6lU6lhGRE8Q.text: A few girls in my group discovered this place by accident, after walking down the wrong road and smelling the heavenly aroma of pizza wafting out the door. Thank goodness for their chance encounter because the pizza here is a delight! The pizza crust is really, really thin, and light, and the flavors are just bursting. I just wanted to keep eating and eating and eating. The individual pizzas are all pretty huge (in my opinion), and I left feeling very full and completely satisfied. For dessert, my friends ordered a tiramisu and a tartufo nero (a ball of sort of whipped custard enveloped in chocolate ice cream, crushed hazelnuts, and cocoa powder... OHMYGOSH so good). Our servers weren't particularly attentive, which was irritating when we needed refills on our drinks and our bill. Regardless, I'm sure we'll be back again.

j-r-9GJYiFNBlOqmmMLruA.text: Pretty close to my flat, really good pizza and it was princess Diana's favorite pizzeria. I loved it!

qle7oei_eL66sWzG5fw5xA.text: I've just come back from this place, and I have to say it was good. Maybe not the best restaurant in my book (I've yet to find one!), but still remarkably good. On the downside, the music is a bit too loud; and the waiter mystified me with the question of whether two plates of pasta, two glasses of red and a plate of garlic bread was all my companion and I required (in the event this proved more than enough!). It's also small, which is a disadvantage when you've got so many guests. And boy was it crowded! I was prescient to book ahead to eat after 7 pm on a Saturday night; later on we saw some people turned away and others queuing outside because there were no tables available. Because it was so busy, in the end it didn't matter that the music was so loud. Anyway, this is a testament to how good their food is. And not too expensive too - the final bill was just under 50 quid including desserts. The small room in a house masquerading as an Italian palazzo is filled with various bric a brac of dubious provenance, some of it apparently celebrating Diana the Princess of Wales who used to be a regular here. But I suspect all these people have a more important reason to flock here; and that's food. Well done.

k95bmuYJwERSOQjtXgw7cg.text: We visited london on the 11.3.2010,we came across this restaurant by chance and must say the service was excellent and the pizzas we had were the very ,very, best pizzas we have ever tasted i would recommend this restaurant to anyone We hope to visit again.

zZSEC54gXV6xpeMu5vJsMA.text: Well, what can I say about Super Mario?Not much really, I never met him. Or any of his employees for that matter. He certainly wasn't super. Superman is super and he can fly and lift really heavy stuff. Mario can't even get me a pizza. We sat, we looked at menus, we were ignored to comedic effect. They even ignored us as we left, nice touch.I didn't even get a drink.I realise that he never claimed to be super (weirdo), but he did make some other various claims. Creator of the pizza express pizzas, Princess Di's favourite pizzeria place et cetera...I HATE Princess Diana. I hope she dies.And I hate you, Super Mario. You are the worst Super Mario game. You aren't even Super Mario Bros 2. You are Mario Hotel.

AsNOdWMpt8g5Y1oOtH74IA.text: I lived in London at the University down the street... and I loved getting Da Mario's on my way home from work. It was easy enough to call in my order (the over baked gnocchi) right before the Piccadilly (from Heathrow) went underground, and it was always ready by the time I got there. The gnocchi is out of this world... I would totally recommend this to anyone who's visiting the area. I never had the pizza though, even though that's what they're "famous for" after having the gnocchi with the mozzarella cheese baked on, I could never even think about ordering anything else!

ULSYwg7PSai3cccDxkHREw.text: We were on vacation and looking for something a bit "better", by our hotel.  We were also drawn by Princess Diana's recommendation.  The small upstairs dining room was jam-packed, but a table opened up right away and although it was a very crowded room, we didn't feel squeezed in, and certainly weren't rushed through our dinner.  We had a good, inexpensive, bottle of wine.  We weren't very hungry, so my husband had an order of Gnocchi Sorrentina ca Serecci, and I had a half-order of the Melanzane Parmigana.  The portions were the perfect size although both meals were so good that we could have eaten more.  The bread was fresh and crisp and hot and perfect for us to sop up the rest of the gravy on our plates.  We were able to linger over our wine and people-watch, and had a very relaxing dinner.  The service was prompt, friendly and good and like I said, no one rushed us so they could turn over the table.  We would definitely go back!  If you're a local or a tourist, take it from 2 Italians who like to eat Italian food - this was VERY good!!

dfQPD_vBmf-P0lwO-KOMFQ.text: This place has great food. Pretty quick service and a good atmosphere!

vG58mWEqkKAq_dWKYdeGoQ.text: This is a pizzeria which gets mentioned in most area guides/ restaurant guides so I was excited to try it. With a friend, I scooted along one Sunday night and we were both left a little cold... The pizza was ok - decent dough, not very thin and Italian, but not US deep either; basically like Pizza Express - but when I chomped into a tinned mushroom it iwas all over. I mean, on a mushroom pizza in a "quality" Italian, I don't expect tinned 'shrooms. Is that too picky? Anyway, the sauce was OK (verging on bland) and there was a LOT of cheese. All in, it was fine, not horrible, but I don't think I would go again.

Exzbop8awnuW82quDfzILg.text: The hilarity of everything near Kensington Palace is that if Princess Diana even looked at a business, they've done something to commemorate it.  This place, put her name on the stairs leading up to it, though in actuality, she probably only ever stopped in there once.  The pizza was alright, honestly for the hype and fanfare they seem to be giving themselves I was expecting to be blown away, but the workers were amazingly friendly and takeout service was always fairly speedy. There's apparently some sort of disco in the basement I think, something that didn't really seem fit in my head of what the upstairs was offering so I never ventured down..  not bad though, I guess if you want a pizza in the area it's better than Pizza Express if you're looking for the individual-style thin pie. Worth a stop, yeah sure... worth a special trip?  ehh..

ofWq__WRj-fjh0C3hj-svA.text: One of the few spots in my neighbourhood that I return to regularly--for the pizza. There is a nice buzz, the service is fine and the pizza is unexceptional but very good. There is nothing not to like at this reliable local.

76y-qMY0Yd2980LXtxhf7Q.text: We loved it here!! Our expectations were fairly low to start, since we had tried a few other good-not-great Italian restaurants in the area. Da Mario knocked it out of the park! We had the bruschetta, pizza, and a basic pasta with tomato sauce and it was all delicious. Reasonable prices, great ambiance. Hoping to return soon!!

LzkQ-G_dVXz4Z80V6jb53Q.text: This place is AMAZING!  I was in London last month (March 2016) and this was recommended by our hotel in Kensington. I am a pizza lover and this was THE BEST pizza i've ever had anywhere! We had the Vesuvio and the Capricciosa. Cant wait to go back to London and eat here again! Paula was our server and she was as sweet as she could be. #YUM

qF6O_KKExGrBeq9lkuNchA.text: AMAZING. Huge menu. All so fresh and delicious it was hard to decide. I went for a friend's birthday dinner. They enjoyed delicious salads and pizzas and just had yummy prawn salad. Nice service. Good prices considering how nice it is. Hope to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Perfection
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Birthday tiramisu! Yum!!
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Prawn salad

UZMmUPbGe5kHoXGKGtN6Pw.text: Casual, quaint, and intimate, right around the corner from Imperial College and Royal Albert Hall. You'll see families, date nights, and those tourists drawn by Princess Diana's recommendation at Da Mario. We made a reservation the first time and of course had no wait time, without one expect up to 20-30 min on busier nights. There is an upstairs area and a downstairs, so there is plenty of room for walk-ins. It looked like the downstairs area could also accommodate very large parties, and the small bar downstairs was nice to wait at as well.Friendly staff (for Italians), always prompt with service, and the food is really well made. I have never had a problem with the service here, but have never come with a group over 4 people. All in all, an enjoyable spot with good food. Also try the chocolate chip and vanilla ice cream for dessert!

FEhvHhNO-VO7Fn-nC_MUuw.text: Amazing spot for an lovely dinner. Although the pizzas are quite small for their value, they are delicious. Every time I go there I order pasta. They have so many choices and in pig portions. My favorite, RIGATONI CON BROCCOLI. An amazing combination of pasta and broccoli. The prices for the dishes are average: neither high nor low. The house wine though is tasteful and cheap.

UVJFMvHD9wRFkwt3NmejlQ.text: So so so good. I don't know what the mixed reviews are about. This place was boss. Had 2 appetizers. I suggest the salami plate. It was too good to be true. Their pizza is the way pizza should be made, and the pasta is fresh and delish. 10\10. Would recommend.

oyK-31PNwSIIB9dIH4Nfzg.text: Excellent new in London. Fed the family of 5 for less than 50. Great meal and we are well satisfied. Highly recommend it for those near and far. See why Diana lived their pizza and why we loved the pasta as well. And the calzone.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Her favorite pizza place

homrEyIRYLWSN9CNCg7tEA.text: We found this place after visiting the Natural History Museum.. It was one of the best Italian places we have ever been to. We are from California so it was sad this place wasn't closer. We ordered the ciabatta and caprese salad as a starter, pizza / pasta for entree, and Tiramisu for dessert. All the food was really fresh and delicious. The balsamic vinegar was particularly interesting (and tasty) as it was probably the thickest I have ever had. The staff was really friendly and on top of it. Next time we are in London we will definitely be making our way here.

LieP1o13_6djrl_Pj37x5A.text: Fantastic food, great service. We had the melanzane parmigiana appetizer and the homemade ravioloni with two of the salad choices. All outstanding!  And it felt like such a friendly place. The owner pays attention to everything, seems to know many of the patrons, and you can see a painting of him with the Princess Diana on the wall. The wait staff was excellent and the food was delivered piping hot. Highly recommended!

0D7ibX3v7Z6DoONiS1FnSg.text: Cozy place. The food is great and reasonably priced for London. And we had very good service.

Fs8hpfjtpZd6keXgDQ_Ujw.text: This is a great authentic Italian pizza restaurant that's been around for years. They have the best starter of garlic and tomato pizza bread. The pizzas are all great and the service is so friendly. You can even order and pick up 15 mins later to enjoy great pizza at home in front of a good film!

Ro0KGIa31xxQuriNarKrlQ.text: Good place for traditional Italian food. Had a three course meals here with some folks from work and felt that each dish was well done and authentic. Service is not the most prompt here, so some hand waving is required to get someone to help you. Overall, i would come back.

xHgBlt1yHeRtDmCrwfXZaA.text: Really lovely if a bit hectic! Nice little spot for dinner and some really fun decor. Good value for the location.

NaJIzUVVGiRoduBoqeai3w.text: This light airy restaurant is just a short walk away from The Royal Albert Hall, inviting  decor and friendly  staff.  The place was busy and had a great atmosphere even at 6pm in the afternoon. Stopped here for pre concert meal before seeing George Benson.  The menu has the usual Italian dishes, pizza, pasta, salad and fish.  Reasonable prices considering we are in the middle of Kensington and the standard of the decor.  I have only ever sat upstairs where you can see them preparing the dishes and it is bright and airy due to the large open windows.  I had penne pasta with pancetta  and cream, it was delicious.  Friends had pizza which looked and tasted great.  Service was quick and polite. Xoxo

rypn-6F7YU64sx_chPk5hQ.text: I am not one to get uppity over restaurant service, or write a review on Yelp, but Da Mario has certainly changed that.In a room with four tables, all with medium sized parties, mine was forgotten about. The table next to me, which sat down 15 minutes after mine did, and ordered after too, not only received their food before us, but also ate everything on their plate, paid, and left before we got our food.No apologies were given, nor anything else.  In fact, the one member of staff who wasn't cowering in fear joked about it.If Princess Dianna got the service we did, it would definitely not be her favorite pizzeria.

Hso9zigAGki1XTAGDGP0Tw.text: Excellent. Restaurant staff were friendly, ambience was appropriate for an Italian restaurant in England. Pizza was tasty. Deserts were good. Not quiet but not too noisy. Will go again.

D_sJceV6naulCU_w9l5hOQ.text: I managed to check out Da Mario a couple of times because I lived only about 2 blocks away. I do have a small fascination with Princess Diana but it wasn't the main factor that convinced me to try this place. No, the main factor was that I often had visitors who were picky eaters so I had to find something that was pretty standard for them. Da Mario was it. The food was delicious! Excellent Italian and they even gave us limoncello one night when we were celebrating a birthday! The reason I don't give it 5 stars is that the service wasn't particularly attentive. Sometimes, they forgot to give us out food or didn't give us what we ordered. But I'm usually not a stickler for things like that because, hopefully when I go out, I'm with people whose company I enjoy!!! If you're just going for the food, it's well worth it!

TUQozYNDbF5ADr-vLAn7RA.text: Given all the other reviews, at first I was a little reluctant to say I really liked this place, went there often, and had great service there when I lived in London for all of 4 months... Then I saw they are mostly from one group, and what restaurant doesn't have an off day here and there?It wasn't the Princess Diana thing that drew my fellow Americans and me there, it was the proximity to our flat, the proximity to our fav pub, and the decent prices that we liked. I also thought the pizza was really tasty and the wine was cheap... I went there with girlfriends for dinner and drinks quite a few times and always had a great time. My friend had her birthday party in the room downstairs and the staff was really attentive and everyone got their food promptly. I like Da Mario's!!

bHt3L56dSHNugbP-doWDkg.text: Beautiful building and external façade. Nice atmosphere too. Service can be a bit messy, but always good-humoured.Starters and salad are really good.Pizza is nice, but perhaps too small.Oven-cooked pasta is really good, and weel-sized but other pasta portions are rather small, though somewhat good.Tirami-su is the "house dessert", but a bit too fatty to my taste...Overall still a nice lace to share a meal with friends.

F680oGdarHuHxWzrbjlAjw.text: Quaint authentic Italian restaurant with family friendly vibe. Pizza reasonably sized. Diana Pizza highly recommended !

0feHT4vbY5IqrsbUFjOEVA.text: Italian Place rumored to have been one of Princess Diana's favorites. Nothing special - they do have an extensive menu but not the best Italian I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Bolognese

E_dBI12seIjGLeHr6tc-SA.text: Slow service when busy. Definitely worth reserving. Absolutely fantastic Italian food. The spaghetti vongole is my favourite dish. Their pizzas are great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Spaghetti Vongole.

DoDJehsnmtPuH9k5uSE2uQ.text: This is one of my favourite Italian restaurants in London, but really it depends on the experience you get.If you're lucky and you get to sit upstairs or outside, it's delightful. Aside from the cheesy painting of Mario serving a pizza to Princess Diana (apparently it was her favourite place too), you get really friendly service and excellent quality food.If you're unlucky you'll have to sit downstairs, where it's sometimes more smelly and it feels like a different kind of restaurant, as it's much bigger downstairs and not as cosy. The food is still good though :)

5CN8Ygl8j1b_McJtBhxfdw.text: A true gem. One of the best meals of the trip. Had the antipasti and pizza bread. All made fresh!! Pasta is al dente and very tasty.

gi6WtriO4GU9FguempCcaQ.text: Wow. This place has great italian food even better than what I had in Italy. Highly recommend to go if you are around ICL area.

jz7vV-X6OsGGc7wiK817sQ.text: This place has amazing pizza! I was very very impressed with the taste and service as wellThere's 2 levels to this place with multiple rooms, I would recommend a reservation on a weekend. The place is small but clean. I would recommend the pizza here, it's amazingOverall I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place based on Price, Service and Taste of food.

7Fc555OgC0UXdQjjral90g.text: Most delicious pizza and pasta I've ever had !!!!! Exquisite food! Made  fresh and just melts in your mouth. I wish we had places like these in the US so glad we stopped by. Amazing Food must have. Best pasta and pizza in London seriously !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The front of the restaurant
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Just exquisite

RU2Wn_JlwlDp85Gc8xCmag.text: My friends and I were actually walking down the street to find another Italian restaurant that I know when we came across Da Mario.  We went inside and it was already quite busy.  However, the owner was there and he made accommodation for us, even though we did not have a reservation.  He was very polite for doing so at the last minute.We had the absolute best food and service from any place I have been to in all the years I've traveled to London.  I will be going back on my next visit and will continue to be a customer!  Try the veal tortellini, it is amazing!  The garlic bread is very unique and fantastic as well.  Great wine selection, too!

8wINXRLql9nrRjkvxfljoQ.text: If your are Muslim then you will love this place because they cater to you. After a decent meal (we are from Philadelphia/NYC so Italian food expectations are high) dessert was a definite. Having lived in Italy, I love a great classic tiramisu and unfortunately I was very disappointed. Menu states "non-alcoholic" tiramisu. When I asked why they told me they didn't want to offend their Muslim clientele. Seriously?? So the ham, shrimp, etc on your menu that is offensive to Hindus and Jews is ok?  WTF?  Everything else on the dessert menu doesn't contain alcohol so why not divert the muslims to those as opposed to ruining the experience of dessert for the vast majority of your clientele??  I've traveled all over the world and have never seen anything so ridiculous.

YY-vGLROz0ZnIsvQDhbtow.text: I live right around the corner from this cute little Neapolitan restaurant. It simply has great food and very friendly waitresses. I've ordered the pappardelle aurora (I always ask to add pancetta) and the melanzane parmigiana and both were great. If the weather is nice, it's lovely to sit outside and order a bottle of wine. I do not like to sit in the downstairs part, the service was slower and it was quite noisy. The waiters and waitresses were always very friendly. A great little spot in South Kensington.

KkBKsoXmPk4vRGQZQpnNGA.text: Authentic, genuine Italian. Stop looking, just go there.

E1JrBengWlc8A1F0H-BwQw.text: This wonderful little spot quickly became my husband and my favorite dinner spot when we visited London. Every item is melt in your mouth delicious. Each ingredient was so fresh and married perfectly. We enjoyed pizza, pastas, and some salad. Each item was expertly and lovingly created. Even the fresh bread is unlike any other!!  My only regret is that they don't have a location in San Diego for me to frequent!!

dB9fV2tgPCYYs0ZdkfsCLQ.text: Incredible!!  The pizza and pasta are wonderful (the even have gluten free).  The atmosphere and ambiance is lovely, in a busy bistro sort of way, but there is a bustling first floor and a more quiet basement.  Service is quick, friendly and professional.  Loved it so much ate there three times in a week.  You can tell is a neighborhood fave where the locals go.

3GSMAO1sItdPidkPMApCbw.text: The pasta is great there, only have that every time.

nVgT-GeKUR6ffZctfMql-Q.text: Awesome food, especially the sea food pizza!We have been eating here regularly and have never been disappointed. Only drawback is the seating area and therefore we rate with 4 stars only. The food quality is worth 5 stars.

0w_hDlVKwyT2HQ2DJ7bHvQ.text: Pizza is bland but pasta is good.  Very nice looking and big restaurant, but the service is slow as all get-out.  We spent about 2 hours there last night waiting for our food.  Didn't mind, because we had good company and wine, but still it's shocking that it would take so long to serve a table of 4.  All we ordered were mains and one appetizer and one bottle of wine.  The appetizer was delicious - it was the aubergine parmigiana.  My husband's rigatoni amatriciana (with pancetta) was also great.  Pizza is meh.  Pricing is fine.  Just make sure you have a LOT of time to spend

Y2H-zJWRCFH8yQZzBKKqOg.text: Special treatment from the manager for my daughters birthday. So glad the taxi driver recommended this place. The pasta was amazing. Great staff! Love this place. An Italian restaurant in England with some reggae playing oh and there's a disco ball! Love it!!  Great taste!!!! Food +

keoXWzT4DfJ98U5z4ivGXw.text: Reasonably priced, good location, plus the added tourist appeal for being princess Diana's "favourite pizzeria". The so called "disco" is kind of awkward, with a funny mix of non sequitur songs and music videos playing.With that said, the service was great and my pizza was amazing! I see why Diana liked it so much;)

REaV9Fop9yQ6vs_xY6JLdQ.text: We have been going here for years. Delicious high quality and authentic Italian food. Whatever you order it's good!

1ftX93oUOjhlSU6Ld1b4DA.text: Fan of this place for the food and the decor, but it is true that the service is a bit poo. All of these southern Italian waiters got some attitude on them, I tell ya. We were a big group and ordered a ton of food - and must say it arrived promptly. Half of us had pizzas and half of us pasta, and the Arrabbiata, the Amatriciana and the Seafood linguine were really actually great. The pizza was good but not outstanding and the tiramisu was pretty good but not great. There was too much whipped cream and not enough mascarpone. But all in all, a good italian place, I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

1bWM9u9Jd3YzQ_QNQq9b8Q.text: My first dinner in London and I'd consider it a major success! I scoured Yelp for a restaurant within walking distance of my hotel in order to get a head start exploring the city as it should be explored--on foot. Eventually I came upon Da Mario Restaurant which stood out when I read that Princess Diana is fond of this otherwise inconspicuous Italian spot. Walking up to Da Mario, it's chilly, but you can still see diners sitting on the patio and lights twinkling as the sun sets. The atmosphere is romantic, but lively. We started with a Fantasia di Bufala, which consisted of buffalo mozzarella, greens and tomato accompanied by olive oil and a sweet balsamic reduction. It was simple and well done, but the mozzarella wasn't as flavorful as I'd hoped it to be. I'd probably pass on this dish if I were to return. The Pappardelle Ragu was absolutely delicious. The flat wide pasta noodles were homemade and cooked to a perfect al dente. The ragu was essentially large chunks of fork tender beef in a tomato based sauce. I finished every last bite. My dining companion ordered the Pappardelle Aurora and also was blown away so I'd say you can't go wrong with one of the handful of Pappardelle dishes on the menu. Da Mario also gets a feather in it's cap for the extra generous wine pours! This spot is definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pappardelle Ragu
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fantasia di Bufala

S84MuWWJei8qreIIRZOIuw.text: The food was good but the service was really slow! We sat downstairs and it was a little bit stuffy down there which isn't particularly comfortable when your trying to enjoy dinner.

ElQ-jswR2AXZcxmFDSbkow.text: I came across this restaurant in yelp and decided to give it a try while visiting London.  My friend and I loved it!  I recommended it to a co-worker of mine who was visiting and she and her husband really enjoyed it.  The food was great and the service was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

vYDH0sasYs6JJa7kVRWJnA.text: This was one of the few restaurants we had to wait to be seated while in London. However with that said, the short wait was totally worth it! We started with the Prosciutto Di Parma, it was perfectly aged and tender. I had the Frutti Di Mare pizza and my girlfriend had the Mario Pizza. Both were delicious (better than we've ever had in Boston's North End). We will be back! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

dMmin9y3MjUWPqO7KMmNow.text: Our second visit here since last year and it still retains that quaint rustic charm.  The upstairs is deceiving because there's a whole other floor downstairs, where all the raucous activity happens.  Food is good and authentic, with excellent execution of pizza crusts. Pasta dishes feel homemade and not commercial.  The staff are great, casual and friendly, especially, as they call themselves, the duo of the crazy French girl and the Egyptian! HAHA. This place was apparently a favorite of Diana's.  We will go again before we leave London.

xjm1zKlz23mT1Zv8zPr55A.text: Oh my god!  The best Italian Restaurant I ever went to!  The service and food excellent!  I was seated in 5 mins on a Saturday night.   Make sure you make reservations!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

ZhIiaAIQlaZBYCmIY0SknQ.text: This restaurant was very close to our hotel on Cromwell Road. We later understood that it was a restaurant frequented by princess Diana. I understand why she would have. It was absolutely excellent. Each dish had a very specific and individual flavor profile. we had fruity D'Mare, Chili tomato sauce and rigatoni, Fussili with sausage and cherry tomato cream sauce. All were absolutely excellent. My personal favorite was our appetizer tomatoes and mozzarella cheese with a balsamic reduction I would highly recommend coming here. it is a wonderful place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

oTJVh0l80aeljheU8rL0YA.text: Loved this neighborhood restaurant. It was loud, crowded, the servers were swamped, and the vibe was happy. Portions were generous (for Europe) and the ingredients were fresh and the flavors robust. They offer a delicious gluten free pasta. Very memorable food. I want to go there for dinner right now! There were 12 of us and we all raved about our meals.

2HGEKDUluhRtlkiNlgHaSw.text: I'll sum it up in one line - Princess Di had GREAT taste! (The princes is said to have dined here and this was her favorite pizza place in the neighborhood - several mementos on the walls pay homage to her)At Da Mario restaurant, everything from the bread to the mains and desert was simply excellent. If you're looking for a no fuss, high on taste meal in central London that wont break the bank, this is it. We started with some focaccia bread that was perfectly warmed and crisp to dip in the two types of olive oils that were on each table - regular and chili. Yumm,This was followed by Prawns Aglio Oglio - delicately spiced and grilled to perfection, these garlicky open faced prawns were a hint of how excellent the rest of the meal was to be. I got the Pappardelle Pasta - cream sauce with spinach, garlic, toasted pine nuts, parmesan and fresh basil. For a change every single ingredient in this list was in the dish and what's more you could taste it in every bite. This has to be one of the most well-balanced pasta's I've ever had. The sauce was just right - creamy, but not too overpowering or drenched in cream that you couldn't taste anything else. Excellent. The husband opted for the Charcoal grilled sea bass fillet, baby squid, king prawn dish that was served with a side salad of mixed greens and cherry tomatoes. I tasted the fish and it had a melt-in-the-mouth type of freshness to it and the crispy bed of salad was excellent as well. To round it all of, we shared the Caramel Custard and I had a decaf espresso - the coffee was decadent and the desert was gently soothing and delightful.Not withstanding the fame that came with the late Princess dining here, the prices are modest and the portions generous. I was a tad skeptical of visiting this restaurant because of the celebrity tag associated with it, but everything including the service was great. Highly recommend you visit De Mario if you get a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. My pasta...loved every bite!
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Caramel custard
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Grilled seas food platter

7SJuArrHRwzAMolQJSY9uQ.text: Very authentic Italian food with a delightful atmosphere.My wife and I enjoyed a dinner composed entirely of daily specials, and everything was wonderful. For antipasti we had the caprese salad with buffalo mozzarella, which was delicious. Entrees were veal tortellini, perfectly cooked and seasoned. For dessert we had a special daily chocolate cake and tiramisu. Everything was fantastically prepared, and service was friendly and helpful. Absolutely recommend this fantastic little place.

Wgsz-u1lKUrCcdFzM897VA.text: Yum yum yum Delicious Italian that reminds me so much of the food in Italy I came for lunch and it was very busy. I made a reservation about an hour before I came and I'm so glad I did. Ordered the bruchetta as a starter.  So delicious! For main I had the rigatoni amatriciana. All I can say is wow! As soon as I tasted it I thought I was back in Rome! The pancetta  had great flavour and there was quite a bit in there. I really wanted to try the pizza but I was dining solo and knew I wouldn't be able to eat it all. Everyone around seemed to be really enjoying their meals. Wouldn't say this place is romantic or good for a first date . Very small and tables are quite cramped.  I didn't see the downstairs part.  Also had the cappuccino which was amazing as well. Very resonably priced . Everything including gratuity came up to about £23.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Rigatoni amatriciana and bruchetta

2B96KNHR2ajUlS0FV64-SQ.text: Took ten minutes for the waiter to recognise our attempts at soliciting menus. No communication, only sullen glares and smatterings of Italian verbiage.

r0_rQwzNfJpxZSKCXGAQLg.text: Favorite place in London. I ate there alone and everyone was so nice and charming. I've had a rough go in London, but at least I can say da marios lived up to every expectation and more.

9q3r4sDCpx-UBgTRI8HPGg.text: It may be good enough for Princess Diana but this place did not wow me at all.I'll start by saying Italian food is probably my least favourite cuisine. It's all so samey and carby. So anyway we booked a table for 5 here but still had to wait 15 minutes to be seated (and we were 5 mins late). The place is very homely but lives on the fact that princess diana came to eat there (maybe once who knows) and her memorabilia are all over the place. I ordered one of the specialities - the spaghetti with clams - and although the pasta was cooked very well, the sauce that came with it was super salty and pretty much just tasted like salty tomato. Portions were also quite small compared to other Italian places I've been to but it was still enough to fill me up. Come for a taste of Italian mama food.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pasta, pizza and salad

58PT9QwLmm2tHDYhUGvz9w.text: Best food in Kensington. Great staff, prices and food. Please do not tell anyone. My go to place. It is hard enough to get a table. I don't know if the Lady Di thing is fact or fiction.

DhFPevwKdbD13LPpzK1ZWA.text: Lovely place, great food, not an expensive restaurant! A hot spot in the neighboorhood!

uLtb9uiI49VKFzp_TP-x2g.text: Warmly recommended and self-touted 'one of the best Italian restaurant' in the world, this tourist-infested Italian restaurant is probably better remembered as Lady Diana favorite Italian than anything else (also in ceramics on the front step - just to make it obvious). The restaurant itself has seen better days, tatty furnitures, pealing paint on some walls, and tacky collections of Italian souvenirs complete the decor. The service was alright but nothing to remember. Food was subpar for one 'of the best' Italian. All the 'specials' were actually on the regular menu, our starter choice of the impossible to screw 'caprese salad/ fantasia du buffala alla caprese' with Mozzarella flown directly from Naples was a complete let down, tasteless tomatoes and chewy Mozzarella... for the main a Spaghetti Vongole, with peproncini (not on the menu description), tomato. Sauce and plenty of oil, I mean pleeenty.. was mostly good because the clams were fresh tasting but otherwise won't leave an undying impression.With all that, we exited the tourist-trap quickly, avoiding the dessert menuThe only real good part came in the form of a Glass of red wine, mostly because it was the size of a fish bowl and made the rest of the dinner bearable. I don't know much about the Italian restaurant scene in London, but I would head somewhere else

jkH5QZcGlO9oGAIgRqC3cw.text: My favorite restaurant in all of London. I lived in South Ken for 5 months and ate at Da Mario's frequently. Every dish is great - however I recommend calling ahead as they are busy most evenings

rkIBVGoNMHbDEULUshx7Qg.text: Recommended by a colleague, we gave this local restaurant a try. Of the three dishes we ordered (Marguerite pizza, Sea bass grilled and pasta special with baby shrimp and porcini mushrooms) the sea bass was really outstanding! The waiters were excellent and I enjoyed a nice prosecco. Glad we stopped by!

ToQzJ0hh1n0UJT67FjuLPA.text: Unbelievably good food. The staff is wonderful and their service is excellent. While visiting and staying in the neighborhood, we ate here two of the three nights we were here. What more can I say.

zvYgmJX0Ys1YMdLvTPGF_A.text: Absolutely amazing. I ordered the Da Mario with Broccoli. The serving size is perfect with just enough sauce. The broccoli was done just enough. And the garlic bread was perfect! Both my aunt and I scraped our plates. She had the traditional Da Mario with ham and mushrooms. I highly recommend!

9JGcmMwp03HF4DuXBFdJ7g.text: Decent, unpretentious Italian restaurant in South Kensington, not far from the Royal Albert Hall and Gloucester Road underground station. We met there as a group (two groups, actually) ahead of the John Williams concert. The service was friendly, if not terribly efficient - the food can be considered solid neighbourhood Italian. The pizzas and pasta aren't spectacular, but freshly made - though at downtown London prices of course (UKP 11 for a standard pizza). I myself had the sepia and shrimp mixed salad, also at UKP 11 - and it was okay, but not better than okay. The atmosphere is nice, if very busy. Solid option near RAH.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

dBXejz-TgrhjvEQJ2bFRMg.text: The food was amazing but the service not so much. When we arrived at the restaurant we were seated quickly downstairs. We ordered the cured meat platter, gnocchi, two seafood pasta dishes, and the spinach and ricotta ravioli. Shortly after our meat platter appetizer was cleared and our waiter came over with the desert menu. 5 minutes later, the waiter came back and asked what we would like. I jokingly say "our dinner".  The waiter smiled then walked away upset.  He came back and explained that the person who clears the table must check on the main courses.  (Honestly, it was no big deal.) He went on to talk about his coworker who didn't know what he's doing.  As soon as he walked away another waiter came over and commented on our food and waiter not being right. Super uncomfortable.

9rkjMNbdKwzlcOdH-1sT_w.text: We know this is a busy place so visited in the middle between lunch and dinner time. We enjoyed more than expected from a lot of reviews here. Pastas and garlic bread ordered were brilliant, concluded soon to repeat visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

jneke-vLwzYBX1a_Rj7FBg.text: The Rigatoni DaMario is a MUST!! We also had the Tortelini Vitelo and the Ragú pasta. Amazing pasta and great ambient

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

qLl87gxqPWu5LImQknyPMw.text: Wonderful Italian restaurant. Very friendly staff. The food and wine was amazing. Fresh ingredients and fast service.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Limoncello
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Best red wine I have ever had.
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Rigatoni da Mario is rigatoni with mushrooms and ham

75d2O9nbJtr1Z8soSveDXQ.text: Absolutely delicious! The service was spectacular, the ambiance was lovely and the smell of garlic lured us in. I don't trust the other reviewers who said that the waiters laughed at them and gave them crappy service. This team was very strong on service and clearly had pride! They even gave us Limoncello on the House! Will definitely visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

OSWCeRlmM-X4y_Tpen6dpA.text: Wow. Wow. Wow. This place killed every Italian restaurant I have been to in California. If you are from the States and want damn good Italian food, come here. First off, it's extremely busy. We were here for dinner and waited outside in the cold (Christmas time) for about 15 minutes. No complaints. It was worth the frost bite my fingers endured.We were seated downstairs, which is a bit unsettling, when you think of the amount of people downstairs and only one way in or out. My mind tends to deviate to worse case scenarios. They do have options for street-level seating, but seating is limited. The pizza was delicious and the pasta was amazing. I'd come back to London for this place alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

y82f-fwGxLMUtBYl4rmx2w.text: As I'm currently studying abroad with my group of friends, we wanted to find somewhere that would take all 13 of us. Da Mario took us without question. The waiter sat us in the back area where was quite hot. However, our service was great! My pasta was served to perfection! Plus our waiter easily accommodated for all of us to pay separately. Will go back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

8FQb7_4nhktjvpJFbppD3g.text: We came here after a concert at RAH. The food was decent enough, but the service left us with a horrible taste in our mouths. They started cleaning up during our main course. All we could taste and smell were the cleaning chemicals. They tried taking away half full glasses of wine. After charging our credit cards, they literally threw our cards and receipts onto the table. While we were waiting for our cars outside, they brought out a large container of greasy liquid and dumped it into the storm drain next to us. I've experienced bad service before, but I've never left a bad review. Thank you Da Mario for being my first.

Qj3fIaOghuD9yhtEvYZTAA.text: Fabulous pizza and outstanding service. You can't go wrong with a visit to this establishment. Not your typical pizza place but an upscale restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pizza Boscialo
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pizza Mario

8kFHD6hybHzuNK2TUs-7kw.text: Had a little bit of a wait but totally worth in. The food was amazing and so was the wine selection. I will return the next time I'm in London.

rUNsvD8gXJoC5CQLCiQMbg.text: GREAT PLACE BUT THEY HAVE TERRIBLE TEMPERATURE CONTROL. That said, I've visited many times and have enjoyed the food and Service. However I cannot give more than theee starts due to continued visits where they have the restaurant almost nauseating with heat. How hard it is to set the temp at 72 degrees - get a Nest Thermostat for gods sake

3CchYIiu14RYvhd1hWbyqA.text: Pizza was amazing! Garlic Bread to start was delicious... waitress was .Ice Cream to top it off... ! Atmosphere and vibe was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

4pQR4dfJJIwPh7rr1PKX6Q.text: I really like the vongole spaghetti and seafood spaghetti here and they are perhaps the only main courses I had and will have here. The spaghettis are absolutely tasty and it does make me wonder how they make their sauce. Definitely worth coming even though it's £15 for their vongole spaghetti!However, it is wise to book seats beforehand. It's not a very big restaurant and it can get really busy even on weekdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Seafood spaghetti - prawn, mussels and squid

2It0f4mXkYgfmze2Set3sg.text: Impeccable service, cozy atmosphere, and the food was amazing!  Start with their pizza sized garlic bread.  Our group of nine had several different pizzas, pasta dishes, salads, and a meat platter to start as well.  We finished with Tiramisu.  This is my second visit at Da Mario.  The price of food and portion size is very generous.  On weekends, check out the ragout that is one of the top entrees.  The meat is cooked for hours and has an amazing flavor.  One in our group visits Da Mario's every week and takes away one of the ragout for lunch the next day.  We enjoyed eating downstairs too.  Cozy and comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Rigatoni Da Mario.

Hs_Jc4QiLRuLro3FTQ16Pg.text: The garlic bread is soo good. Service was great and the food was delicious. 100% recommended

sUx2MmoJAtG5Jmc91N2nyQ.text: Concierge recommended. This place was so wonderful. Pizza, buffalo cheese, all ingredients fresh!

yD7RRUOaTTVm921hidvQNA.text: We are looking for an  intalian restraunt today after whole day tour. Due to the yelp, I had an amazing italian dinner. Good taste with good view. We orded a lot,but finished soon.Hahahahaha.I almost have the feeling of the wall to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Da Mario Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

jSSi0__yWaVuT5LiUdkM9w.text: As an Italian American from NYC, this place is awesome!  Great food, great red sauce, delicious pasta and pizza. Family friendly. The owner bought us a Lemoncella after dinner drink.  Service was great. No matter where we are when we visit London, it is worth the Taxi ride.

j8YQ_x3W3_0dmctFtT8-SA.text: Just Fantastic, Excellent italian pizza (even though it was cooked by an moroccan) and excellent grilled dishes, every time we try something new we say this is the best and then something else comes along. If you live or visit London (or willing to) and like to taste great food, you must go to this restaurant. Service is very italian which means that it comes with its pitfalls.

jT-WXGSuGEQnf2Ge3yRtqA.text: I heard the hype that Lady Di used to bring the boys here to slum it and eat pizza. Actually, it was really great! The upstairs is small and cramped but it buzzes with charm and seems really popular. The staff are super friendly and the food is excellent. It has the quaint charm that I was hoping for in place of the cheese factor of knowing about the mystique of the place. The downstairs is a bit odd, in the that upstairs you expect nouveau riche slumming it for pizza and fine wine in a cozy restaurant, while the basement looks like a Latvian club. Advice: eat upstairs, piss downstairs.

kgIPNsoCBbR0fKDZMWMBiw.text: Gotta go when you're in London. Good pasta, excellent pizza and wine! Service was ok...Princess Di fans a must see. And the Princess Di's pizza is unusual, but surprisingly very tasty and I'm a Chicago girl! Loved it!
